website_summaries.verdict: If you have to round up a mess of USB-powered devices for your desktop Mac, you can’t go wrong with this relatively inexpensive, convenient, and super-fast USB hub from Amazon.
pros: Convenient 3 foot long USB cable and power adapter
Up to 5Gbps of speed via 2 USB fast-charging ports
cons: While Amazon’s USB hub works perfectly with USB 3.0 and 2.0 devices, it is incompatible with older USB 1.0 devices

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work for IPhone
customer_reviews.text: I have not had a lot of luck with AmazonBasics products, and this one is no exception. Very slow charging anything, and doesn't seem to like Apple products. Plus no manual included so I had to search here to find out what the power adaptor is supposed to be for. Will be returning it. 5 months later: I should have returned it when I said I was. IF it works, it takes 2 hours to update my IPhone to a new operating system. Usually, it quits about 1.5 hours in and i have to start all over again.
customer_reviews.author: L&C

customer_reviews.title: Possible Fire Hazard
customer_reviews.text: It worked while it worked and then my hard drives that were plugged into disconnected in the middle of working and then there was a burning smell. The back of the hub melted. No flames but definitely a concern. Picked up the carbon color aluminum Anker brand hub and it's leaps and bounds better in terms of design and build quality and for the same $16.99. Luckily my laptops were not shorted or damaged in anyway. The cables are still fine too. I requested a refund but unfortunately I was outside of the one year warranty. Amazon customer support was great as always even though they couldn't replace the unit.
customer_reviews.author: GM

customer_reviews.title: Great for external HDs that don't have their own AC adapter
customer_reviews.text: My computer doesn't provide enough power for my external hard drive. Because of this, my external would always disconnect randomly while backing up files, causing a lot of trouble. At best, the data transfer speed would slow down significantly. I was told I should connect it to an external power source, like a USB hub, and I wouldn't have that problem anymore. I got this, and now my external HD never randomly disconnects anymore! I can safely transfer large multi-gig files without having to constantly monitor the connection.
customer_reviews.author: CHT

customer_reviews.title: Basic but high-quality USB3 hub. Just works.
customer_reviews.text: Amazon Basics USB 3 hub is a simple, small device that just works. It provides power with the supplied power adapter, and supports four USB connections. Only 4 stars for versatility because the cable to connect to the computer port is rather short. The device comes with an instruction booklet, which is hardly necessary, but might be helpful in the odd case of problems. However, the booklet has a typo in the “Connection is slow” troubleshooting section. It refers to needing to plug the unit into a USB 2.0 port. This should say USB 3.0. This is probably a holdover from the instruction booklet for a previous version, a bit of sloppy editing. A very minor flaw in the product.
customer_reviews.author: Dick Rubinstein

customer_reviews.title: Died within 12 hours of installation.
customer_reviews.text: Failed within 12 hours of installation. It was working just with a number of USB 2 devices plugged in, all HID (keyboard+mouse, another keyboard+mouse, IR receiver that emulates a keyboard, XBox 360 controller recevier). Then without any warning, Windows played the USB-device-disconnected" noise and everything disappeared. I tried reconnecting everything, other cables. It was in a wide open space, I can't imagine there being any heat problems, and it certainly didn't feel warm. Beyond that, it has a REALLY annoying, piercing blue LED on the top. I'm okay with a small LED to let me know that it was working, but this thing just grabbed your eye from across the room. It's a USB hub, it's just not that important!
customer_reviews.author: AD

customer_reviews.title: Works but not a real charger
customer_reviews.text: So it works, it does what is described to do as a hub (hence four stars). But it would be helpful to add further description on if/how it supports charging. It doe not support charging when plugged into an AC adapter. However it does support charging when plugged into a USB port on my laptop. That is strange. Not clear what it blocks from an AC adapter but allows to pass through from a laptop USB port. Should just be 5VDC coming into the hub in both situations, but it clearly discriminates between the two situations.
customer_reviews.author: JPK

customer_reviews.title: Works on some netbooks where others don't.
customer_reviews.text: You know what happens...you have a small, older netbook/notebook with two USB ports. You use one for your mouse and you need to access two USB flash drives. Unfortunately, I have found that my older USB hubs will trigger a warning that my older netbook can't support the hub due to excess power consumption. This hub is one of the ones that DOES work just fine without any external power source. I've had three separate USB flash drives, plus a mouse receiver, plugged into it at the same time without any problem (on a Lenovo S-10, of all things). Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Zube

customer_reviews.title: Works with most but not all devices.
customer_reviews.text: Pros: compact size lightweight works fine with most devices works fine with & without power adapter Cons: Won't allow iPhone to charge or sync Western Digital My Passport has trouble connecting via this hub This USB hub has been working fine for most devices (keyboard, input devices, scanner, charging headphones) but my biggest concern so far has been the hub's inability to allow my external HDD to connect to MacBook. "Disc not readable" and "unable to eject" errors were constantly generated even after login/logout and shutdowns. While the hub addresses many of my needs, it does not help with the most important ones: iPhone and WD external HDD.
customer_reviews.author: Santidiablo

customer_reviews.title: Works great but the design leaves a bit to be desired.
customer_reviews.text: Works like a charm. Deducted one star because of the design. Specifically, the power USB cable, which is quite hefty, and the power adapter port are located on the left side. The relatively clean design is disrupted by these large cables extending off to the side, which requires an additional 3 inches or so of space required for the hub on the desk. Certainly doesn't affect functionality, but had these been put on the back and two USB ports put on the side, the whole thing would be more streamlined.
customer_reviews.author: DrFranco

customer_reviews.title: Pretty Well Built For The Price so far can't complain
customer_reviews.text: Recently picked up a small 12" dell laptop for taking on the road as well as reading check engine codes. This laptop only came with 2 usb ports and i wanted to add a few more. So far this Amazon Basics 4 Port may be the right tool for the job. I litteraly just set it up and so far it has been plug and play. The hub looks and fills pretty solid so i have hi hopes. This is deafnitly the best price for a 4 port hub. I will post any issues if any arise. So far so good!
customer_reviews.author: TrkrNerd

customer_reviews.title: Great usb splitter
customer_reviews.text: I use this for my patrol car as I only have 1 USB port but multiple things I use with usb. I used to switch items in and out of USB port. With this I don’t ever have to unplug anything. I use 3 out of 4 ports right now. I wish I had gotten this 3 years ago. The only complaint I have is the entire housing unit feels a little cheap/weak. It has not broken yet... but fear it may. I placed Velcro on the bottom side and stick it to the tablet docking station. Works well so it’s not flopping everywhere while I’m driving.
customer_reviews.author: TheFahFamily

customer_reviews.title: Gets the job done... a little flimsy
customer_reviews.text: Don't get me wrong, this product definitely works as advertised, but the materials seem a little cheap. One of the ports doesn't really easily fit a USB in/out (it gets a bit stuck). However, I would buy it again and recommend it to others. It's worked for many months without any actual tech issues.
customer_reviews.author: S.A.M.

customer_reviews.title: IT JUST WORKS, AND IT'S INEXPENSIVE
customer_reviews.text: I recently purchased an all-in-one PC and the main thing it lacked was an adequate number of ports for USB peripherals...after plugging in the mouse and keyboard there were only two remaining. With this thing I was able to accommodate the mouse, keyboard and printer in one USB 2.0 port on the back, freeing the ones on the side for thumb drives and other, more transient (and faster) connections. It has worked like a champ with no hangs or other problems.
customer_reviews.author: Bruce E Bowman

customer_reviews.title: BRIGHT AS HELL LED
customer_reviews.text: 1/5 stars. Why? Because of that obnoxious LED. Apparently modern design means jam as many lights as you can in there even if they serve no function. Oh? It's to let me know it's connected? Well gee whiz thanks for the heads up I couldn't possibly have gotten from testing my peripherals and seeing whether or not they're connecting. Replaced this product with an unlit similar product from Best Buy. You should do the same.
customer_reviews.author: Karl T

customer_reviews.title: Great, Inexpensive USB Hub
customer_reviews.text: This is a great, inexpensive USB 2.0 hub. I purchased this to add easy access USB ports in a small compartment in my desk, and this did the trick. I have three available USB ports on the front (which I usually use for USB headsets, flash drives, and the other miscellaneous USB devices that I have sitting around). The port on the side with the connection cable is dedicated to my wireless keyboard and mouse dongle. I recognize that USB 2.0 may be a bit dated, but for the stuff I use with this, I don't really mind. Great product for a great price!
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: Small and mostly unobtrusive.
customer_reviews.text: This is for the 4-Port USB 2.0 Ultra-Mini Hub. It works perfectly for my intended purpose, which was to reduce the cable clutter around my laptop and add a some extra ports. Currently I have an external keyboard, scanner and printer connected to it. Because the scanner and printer are self-powered I didn't need a powered hub, which means less room required and not additional power bricks, etc.. The USB connector cord is long enough that it sits behind my laptop fairly unnoticed. Fairly I say because it has a fairly bright yellow LED which illuminates when it is plugged in. All in all a good buy for less then $7 and free shipping with Amazon Prime.
customer_reviews.author: Ernest Pergrem

customer_reviews.title: Simple and works fine.
customer_reviews.text: Simple and works fine. This USB 3.0 hub comes with an external power supply, so it will power devices that might otherwise steal too much power from your computer's USB port. (The complication is that, if you use it in conjunction with external hard drives, the external power will keep them turned on all the time, even when the computer is turned off. I found that it works fine without the external power, at least for my purposes, so I disconnected the power supply.) USB 3.0 can generate high frequency interference that can do funny things to USB 2.0 devices, so if, for example, your wireless mouse starts acting funny, try moving the receiver to a different USB port.
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: only 40% of the ports are working after 5 months.
customer_reviews.text: I have lots of USB cords that need tending to, so I opted for the 7 port USB hub. Works well, but after a few weeks I noticed my Fitbit wasn't charging on the port it was on. I moved the port, it seems to work. So I guess 6/7 on the ports work. If another drops off before the exchange period, Ill swap it out. **Update** 4.12.18 Now 4 out of 7 (60%) of the usb ports do not charge. 1/2 of those are the quick charge ports. Not sure why, this thing does not leave my desk, but these ports just stop working. Id keep looking, after 30 days you are on your own.
customer_reviews.author: Damazon Prime

customer_reviews.title: Hardly functional
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because my new laptop only has one USB Type A port, and I need to plug in a Logitech keyboard and mouse. The mouse cuts out and requires me to disconnect/reconnect to the hub every 30 seconds or so. I have tested the mouse on other systems and without the hub, and did not have this problem. Don't try to save money with this product--invest in a quality USB hub.
customer_reviews.author: Kayla P.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for any peripherals
customer_reviews.text: I use this to handle two smart card readers, a gaming mouse, a Saitek flight stick, and two Oculus Rift VR sensors. It's able to supply enough power to each of those devices and doesn't seem to have any bandwidth issues. It's not a super high power output hub (my Pixel 3 XL only shows "charging slowly"), but the bandwidth alone is enough for me to recommend it. I just wish the cord was a tad longer so I could keep it in my desk drawer.
customer_reviews.author: Isaac

customer_reviews.title: Lasted only five years
customer_reviews.text: This was a great compact 4-port USB hub while it lasted. It had a nice short USB connection cord and a long enough power cord to fit snugly in a niche that I had for it. Then several of the USB ports lost the ability to power USB connections. Another port could charge a device at reduced power levels, but failed to USB connect to that device plugged into it. I replaced it with a Sabrent powered USB 3.0 4-port hub rather than an identical AmazonBasics model.
customer_reviews.author: d_l

customer_reviews.title: Fast charging ports didn't work
customer_reviews.text: This would have been exactly what I needed, had it worked. Unfortunately, neither of the two "fast charging" ports provided enough power to charge my Google Pixel. The ports should have been outputting 5v, which is plenty to quick charge the Pixel. The fact that the phone would barely charge at all suggests something is wrong with the power going to the ports. Issues with ports seems to be a common user problem with this device, so am returning for something else.
customer_reviews.author: JoshNYC

customer_reviews.title: Another Amazon hub fails
customer_reviews.text: I bought a 10 port USB hub from Amazon which lasted awhile then the power supply failed. They don't make that anymore so I bought this 7 port hub from Amazon and managed to squeak out a year or so of use before, once again, the power supply failed. I have been an Amazon customer for years but I am starting to have my doubts about the quality of the Amazon Basics brand. I will shop for a replacement.
customer_reviews.author: K. Royal

customer_reviews.title: Been solid so far
customer_reviews.text: I was a little hesitant to buy this based on reviews indicating the failure rate isn't great. I've had this for a year now, plugged in, in use every day for the past year. I have had zero problems. It been a solid little workhorse (*knocks on wood*). You may get a dud, that seems to be possible. But just exchange it out and get another one. It's been a solid product for me. I use it on my macbook pro with a wired usb ethernet adapter (amazon basics as well) and have zero problems.
customer_reviews.author: dupsatou

customer_reviews.title: Worked great then destroyed hundreds of dollars of electronics.
customer_reviews.text: I've had this for years and didn't have issues running multiple hard drives, midi controllers, etc. But in the last year it has literally been fry (electronically destroying) various bus powered devices. First it was a $20 web cam (It broke an extension cable first), then it zapped a USB audio interface "(Not cheap). Honestly, Amazon should pay for making a faulty product or at least sell this with a warning.
customer_reviews.author: splashtop

customer_reviews.title: Works for PS4/PSVR
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this specifically to expand the usb universe of the original PS4. If you are like most owners you’ll have an external hard drive connected to one USB port (requires direct connection) and you’ll be left with a single usb. The PSVR also requires at USB port and despite what I’ve read it can work on a 3.0 hub like this one. So PSVR in and 3 additional USB ports for charging controllers etc. The short length on the hub is not ideal, I’m still able to use it and keep the wiring clean by having a drawer beneath the PlayStation for the various extensions.
customer_reviews.author: andre surles

customer_reviews.title: Now strongly recommend 1-2020
customer_reviews.text: Right out of the box it quickly was recognized by my laptop. I plugged in an external DVD reader/writer and printer and both work thru this mini HUB just fine. Small and nice construction. Time, of course, will tell. Update January 2020: Have been using this port for almost a year now with problems. I use it with a laptop for printer and DVD player/recorder and it has never (NEVER) had an issue.. Highly recommend Feb 2020 - Just ordered a second unit to work with my laptop, what does that tell you? March update: The 2nd unit works without a flaw.
customer_reviews.author: R. Sutton

customer_reviews.title: Anthem; Consumer Advoicate  Works well, well made. Way too light and small and moves around very easily with cables attached.
customer_reviews.text: Anthem: Consumer Advocate I have two of these. It like it for the most part, and works well. I like the power supply that comes with it. It appears to be well-made and solid t is much more convenient to have the ports right there, within reach. The negative that gives it a lower rating is the fact that it is too small and lightweight and moves around very easily, especially with cables attached to it, which also makes it sit uneven on a desktop. That is the big con. Otherwise, OK.
customer_reviews.author: Anthem

customer_reviews.title: Worked for four years.
customer_reviews.text: This worked well for about three years. Then the external disk drive wouldn’t always wake up if it had been idle for a long time. Had to remove, then restore power (drive has its own power brick) to get it back. I assumed it was the disk drive as it is several years older than the hub. Order a replacement drive and found that several of the ports don’t work. The new drive will power on from the hub, but the computer doesn’t see it. Funny thing is that the ports that work are the ones that had devices plugged in, but the ports that didn’t have anything plugged in don’t work.
customer_reviews.author: JDP

customer_reviews.title: works, decent quality, good value
customer_reviews.text: Works well. Seems to be reasonably well made and sturdy. The connectors don't all perfectly line up with the case holes, but they're close enough. Cord is 10 inches from outside the shell of the box, to the tip of the USB connector. I wish it were longer. I'm going to have to use this with a USB extension cable. The LED is _very_ bright, but I can dim it down with some tape. That's much better than if it were too dim, and I had to use it in bright light or something. Overall, this is a good little hub for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Doke Scott

customer_reviews.title: nice and small, but slows charging time
customer_reviews.text: At first I thought this was a great little adapter to help me charge all my usb charged electronics overnight. I wanted to simplify all the cords that go along with that, but then I realized that my phone charges too slowly to be effective when I use this device. I unplug the device, the phone charges quickly, I plug the phone charging cable into the device, then it charges slowly, so this isn't useful for me for either home or travel, since my phone will always be one of the devices I will be charging. I've used other travel adapters for this same purpose and not had any slowing in my charging time.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa Bullitt

customer_reviews.title: Worked great...until it didn't
customer_reviews.text: Multiple devices (external drive enclosure, printer, iPhone/iPad) were connected to this hub, which was in turn connected to a Mac (macOS 14.x). All worked as expected until macOS Security Update 2020-002 Mojave (2020-03-24). Following that security update the external drive would not mount. After Security Update 2020-004 Mojave (2020-07-15) the printer could still be seen by the OS but would not print. iPhone/Pad continue to connect as expected. Are these problems Apple's fault? Most likely, yes. But my inability to update the hub's firmware means it becomes another piece of tech junk.
customer_reviews.author: ARG

customer_reviews.title: It's a USB hub.  It does its job.
customer_reviews.text: Not much to say about this product except it works well. I use it to connect multiple Arduinos while I'm doing some of my "more interesting" Arduino projects. They plug in, they are recognized. The hub's power supply drives them all quite well (including moderate loads -- short LED strips, sensors, RF, etc.). Improvements I'd like: A longer USB cord (to the PC) and a power supply that wasn't a wall wart (one that had a short power cable to the AC outlet as well as a longer power cable to the hub). But, for $18 or so, I'd definitely buy it again. And the next time I need one, I definitely will.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Platt

customer_reviews.title: Incredibly noisy; beware of electrical interference.
customer_reviews.text: Not suitable for use with anything resembling audio equipment. As soon as I connected the power supply to this 7-port USB3 hub, the hub started emitting an audible high-pitched whine. When I plugged it into my computer's USB bus, things got even worse: the whine started pervading the entire system bus, including the built-in sound card and a separate USB audio interface. Long term, I'm afraid this hub would damage my equipment. Short-term, it's intolerably noisy anyway.
customer_reviews.author: Bryan C. Mills

customer_reviews.title: I purchased two of these to use with a Macbook ...
customer_reviews.text: I purchased two of these to use with a Macbook Pro. I've found that, even with the powered adapter, this unit often disconnects devices due to low power, usually a combination of my Logitech Unifying adapter and a USB3 to ethernet adapter. The idea was that I could connect my work laptop at home to several peripherals and have a home office. However, this has under-delivered do the point that it gets in my way of getting work done.
customer_reviews.author: SilentSpell

customer_reviews.title: It's a piece of junk
customer_reviews.text: I tried to select a product at the higher end to provide a port for my many tablets. I thought this product would provide rapid charging and reliable service. Product does not work. I did not realize until a week later when I picked up what should have been a fully charged tablet that had no power. I went through the stack and none had been charged. I unplugged the device and tried again. It just doesn't charge my tablets. My other plugs in the same surge protector work perfectly. It's just a piece of junk.
customer_reviews.author: Sandra M. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Power Will Not Stay On
customer_reviews.text: I have the 4 port model. When I fist got this it didn't work with external USB HDs. Later I discovered that the power was not on so I firmly pushed in the power plug then the power light came on and it started working. But a short time later the power went away and it hasn't worked with USB HDs since. It works with thumb drives and a USB receiver for a wireless mouse because they don't require much power. Since I got this so I could have multiple USB HDs connected to my Laptop is useless to me. I have now taken it apart to see if I can fix it myself.
customer_reviews.author: jackcf

customer_reviews.title: PS4, logitech racing wheel, steel series headphones are a no go with this product.
customer_reviews.text: I have this 4 usb port connected to my ps4. I used it once and only. I had only my headphones and logitech wheel connected through this device. My headphones would turn off, then back on. I didn't keep this device in long enough to find out if it would do the same to the racing wheel. This is the first time I've been disappointed with an Amazon product. However, I can NOT say this device was intended for the use that I wanted it t do.
customer_reviews.author: PBJason

customer_reviews.title: A very good hub, may have compatibility issues with obsolete devices.
customer_reviews.text: This is a very good hub. Unfortunately, I had a compatibility issue. The hub failed to recognize a microsoft mouse and keyboard. They are recognized when directly connected to the laptop. My Sony Vaio laptop runs Vista, which might provide an incompatible environment. Amazon support was terrific and allowed me to exchange at no cost. The exchanged item behaved the same way. My computing environment may be unusual and should not deter a potential customer with new equipment. The port works just fine with external USB 3.0 drives and a USB printer. I dropped from five stars to four stars because of my compatibility problem, otherwise it would be five stars.
customer_reviews.author: H. Stone

customer_reviews.title: Great value, functionality, easy setup
customer_reviews.text: It’s only been a day so my review may not be comprehensive. That said, hubs are hubs at their core. The difference here is that it’s styling is pleasing on my desk, the five ports are in the back which hide sticks and attached cables nicely, there are two super fast ports on the side, plus etup was super easy. Finally, I like that this model has its own power supply so that devices aren’t reliant on power from the computer, especially for devices that need the juice. Summation: I recommend this hub for its value, functionality, and easy setup.
customer_reviews.author: Bert

customer_reviews.title: External hard disks are non-functional.
customer_reviews.text: This is on the 4 port hub. Unit works well with a flash drive and an old borrowed self-contained external drive. Does not work with my 2 external hard disks in enclosures. Both work fine when directly connected to my computer, not through the hub. The hub shows the proper drive letters, so I know it has accessed each disk to that extent, but reports each disk as "Removable Disk" when they are simply 500GB 2.5 inch SATA disks in plastic enclosures. I replaced this hub with aand both drives show as if directly connected, almost instantly, no issues at all.
customer_reviews.author: Al Mansur

customer_reviews.title: Best USB3 hub ever (for my purpose)
customer_reviews.text: Only small size 4 port USB3 hub that supports uhubctl to switch on/off power per port. Pretty sad that none of the other small sized USB3 hubs support this standard feature. I use these to connect 2.5" 5TB USB drives / DVD drives internally in PCs so i can switch off their power until the time when i need to access them/ Or just power cycle them through a program. Alas, windows is also lame, so uhubctl only works on non-windows OS.
customer_reviews.author: te36

customer_reviews.title: Good but I have a minor issue in Linux
customer_reviews.text: I'm using this with a computer running Ubuntu. I like it. My only problem is my mouse is not always recognized when I boot (sometimes but often not). It requires me to unplug the mouse and plug it back in. I don't have this issue when the mouse it plugged directly into the computer. It's a hassle. Not a deal breaker breaker for me though - I'm a Linux user and used to minor inconveniences. It helps when you don't have the computer in easy reach. Great for peripherals that rely on USB for power.
customer_reviews.author: James TTop Contributor: Writing

customer_reviews.title: Did not work for me, loose connection ports and device disconnection problems
customer_reviews.text: I'm not sure whether I received a defective unit or the product design is poor. I had trouble plugging devices into the hub and getting them to work reliably. I had to wiggle one of my USB drives around just to get a good connection in the hub, and the connections felt loose. Even with the power supply plugged in, I still had issues with devices dropping offline and I lost the signal to my wireless Logitech keyboard adapter constantly. I returned this unit and purchased an Anker hub that works wonderfully with none of the above problems (on the same computer USB 3.0 connection). I can't recommend this product, but as always Amazon came through with an immediate refund.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Phelps

customer_reviews.title: Works with WiiU, but not vWii
customer_reviews.text: Five stars because this is not a limitation of the USB hub, which works fine. Would be nice if it had a light to indicate whether or not power was being provided, but I digress. The WiiU provides limited power to its USB ports, which means most hard drives won't work unless they have their own power supply. This hub provides that power, and every 2.5" unpowered drive I tested worked fine. However, the vWii emulator is unable to see anything plugged into a USB hub, powered or not. If you are looking for a solution for the vWii, this isn't it.
customer_reviews.author: Fnord

customer_reviews.title: Devices keep dropping out
customer_reviews.text: It actually takes some power from the usb port to light up the led, which was not mentioned in the product description. I have two fairly low power devices hooked up, and they occasionally cause the usb port to shut down, dropping the devices out. Not had a problem with another unpowered usb hub I have, but that one is too big to fit. So I am opting to get an usb splitter instead, no lights to use up power.
customer_reviews.author: danno

customer_reviews.title: Ridiculous inefficiency
customer_reviews.text: Defective: Already broken near the connector so have to twist the connector to get it powered, and every slight nudge of the thing which obviously happens every time something is plugged or unplugged caused it to lose power until fiddled with again. Ridiculous: Adapter label says 100-220V @ 1.2A input and 12V @ 3A output. That's <expletive>ing 30% efficiency at the very best. The hub itself looks nice and feels sturdy enough, but the power supply is just ridiculous. It's 2017. 30%-efficient DC transformers are not remotely acceptable.
customer_reviews.author: G. P.

customer_reviews.title: so highly recommended.
customer_reviews.text: Works perfectly with my Xbox One X, I have my external hard drive and wireless Turtle Beach headphones plugged into this and it into the #2 back port of the Xbox, as port 1 is taken up by the Kinect converter (necessary on the One X due to the lack of the dedicated Kinect port). I'm using it without the power adaptor as I'm not driving anything on it that's drawing power from it, and it's working perfectly. A lot of people have complained they bought hubs for their Xbox Ones that can't support multiple devices at once - this one does, so highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey Tschiltsch

customer_reviews.title: Cord Too Short
customer_reviews.text: The product itself is great. Good quality build. Functions flawlessly. But the entire point (for me and I think a lot of people) of getting one of these things is so you can have USB access on your desk rather than have to crawl under your desk to plug something in. The USB cable provided is only about 2 feet long. Not nearly long enough to get from my PC tower up to my desktop. A sad oversight for an otherwise fine product.
customer_reviews.author: Stan Culotte

customer_reviews.title: It gets five because it works
customer_reviews.text: Its getting five stars because it works well. However.... I did cannibalize it, for the addition of an alternate input power source (a USB charger battery pack). Once inside... yikes! The board had monumental rework done to it! Writing and rework stickers all over it. Maybe call it quality control, but I was amazed at the amount of rework spots...which totaled twenty one places (by the sticker count). Sturdy construction otherwise. Was simple to hot-wire the charger plug to allow me to plug it into a USB Lithium Ion battery.
customer_reviews.author: Charlie B

customer_reviews.title: Still going strong
customer_reviews.text: I got the hub after a couple of others went South on me for no apparent reason. Since I don't use them to pound nails or anything, I'm not sure why they kept quitting on me. I've had this one longer than the last two put together and it's still going strong. All I ask for is something that works and continues to do so for a reasonable amount of time. I am quite pleased with this product.
customer_reviews.author: F. Homan

customer_reviews.title: but I'd rather have it on the bright side than the dark side like some of my other hardware
customer_reviews.text: This has been constantly plugged in for the past few months and hasn't burned out or blown my motherboard. I have 3 USB thumb drives plugged into it for RAID testing. They just barely fit side by side. Port 4 is by the USB cable and is a bit awkward, but it isn't a deal killer. The amber colored power LED is a bit bright, but I'd rather have it on the bright side than the dark side like some of my other hardware. It's much easier to see if it is on in the daylight from across the room. If you don't like the brightness, put a small piece of masking tape on top of it.
customer_reviews.author: Brett E Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Excellent for a laptop!
customer_reviews.text: Need a few more USB ports on your laptop or notebook computer to add mice, full-size keyboards, thumb drives, or other devices? This is perfect! It plugs into one USB port and gives you four to use in its place. It's small, flat and slim, too, so it packs into a carrying case easily so it is always with you when you need it. Works just fine for desktop systems and small single-board computers like Raspberry Pis, too, of course.
customer_reviews.author: Michael H.

customer_reviews.title: Basic inexpensive Hub for USB
customer_reviews.text: Right now I have my Fitbit dongle, my USB drive and my razor head phone dongle which is plugged into an extension cord all plugged in working with this hub. The only time I had any problems was when I tried to plug in the dongle for my wireless xbox one controller. Love the slim disgine of the box. The only thing I would change to make the product better would be a longer cord.
customer_reviews.author: clara10159

customer_reviews.title: Compact and has one of the ports on the rear for more permanent peripherals
customer_reviews.text: It's compact and has one of the ports on the rear for peripherals you rarely need to remove. The cord is intended for mobile use. The short cord is also handy when you need quick access to something like a YubiKey. Cons: The amber LED is distracting. It's super bright for no apparent reason. It's odd that Amazon never came out with a USB 3 SuperSpeed version of this really handy hub.
customer_reviews.author: Kris

customer_reviews.title: Take this Hub to the pub
customer_reviews.text: POWERED USB HUBS ARE THE BOMB. I have a Hinge Dock for my macbook pro and I leave this connected to it at the office. I can attach whatever I want and leave my external hard drives plugged in while I take my macbook on the go. IDK if this is a real thing but my computer seems to work faster with USB items than before, it used to take a few seconds to recognize drives or eject them but now it's instant. I think I even get boosted transfer speeds!
customer_reviews.author: Reverend Tubby

customer_reviews.title: Great part for a Pi Zero project.  One of those things that "just works"
customer_reviews.text: Needed this for a Pi Zero project and it ended up working out perfectly. Absolutely zero complaints, and would purchase again in a heartbeat. It's worth noting that for my project I had to remove the plastic casing AND rip out the LED light to get clearance for the case it was going in. It works flawlessly! It is worth noting that I've had outstanding luck with every AmazonBasics part I have purchased -- everything from inexpensive items like this all the way up to an executive office chair. This stuff is the real deal.
customer_reviews.author: Craig L.

customer_reviews.title: hard drives occasionally disconnect
customer_reviews.text: Works great for peripherals other than drives. Hard drives connected via this hub will occasionally and randomly disconnect and re-connect, interrupting any disk operations (backups, etc.) occurring at the time. I've experienced this with multiple drives and USB cables, and have replaced the hub-to-computer cable. Computer, hub, and drives are all powered through UPS. No problems with other peripherals such as phones, keyboards, mice, headsets, etc.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Baumbach

customer_reviews.title: Just what I needed!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to use with a laptop that had only two USB ports. One was being used for the mouse, and the other for an external hard drive. Since I periodically needed to add files to the external drive, it was irritating to remove the external drive, copy the files to the hard drive and copy them back to the external drive. Now I can copy them directly from the thumb drive to the external drive. Talk about a time saver! The best part is that it fits in the same case as the external drive when I am traveling!
customer_reviews.author: Maureen F. Coressel

customer_reviews.title: Dies after a few months.
customer_reviews.text: Like others here, my experience with this hub has been largely positive - initially. I'm using it on my iMac 5K Retina. It works flawlessly for a few months, and then just randomly no longer does. I don't know if the power supply goes bad or what. It just stops working (no attached devices are recognized, etc.). I tried using another USB port on my computer, recycling the power, etc. Nothing helps. The device literally dies after a few months.
customer_reviews.author: nycrob81

customer_reviews.title: Handy as all get out
customer_reviews.text: I work off an older Asus that took a fall and as a result has only one working usb port. This has been a life saver, letting me connect with my mouse and a bluetooth ue boom2 speaker, plus lets me back up to my external passport hard drive. I bought one that plugs directly into the usb port and can swivel, thinking it would be better. Nope. This works far better. Good product.
customer_reviews.author: kevin mangan

customer_reviews.title: Versatile and compact - seems to be a good value
customer_reviews.text: I like having the power and data connection on one end so I can route those cables to the back. I've got the 5 jacks on the side going to devices I don't change much (if ever) and the 2 on the end are available for flash drives and other things that come and go. It works well and I also like that it can work with or without a power adapter. The power adapter is large with plenty of power for whatever I might plug in.
customer_reviews.author: Steven Loscheider

customer_reviews.title: This product is absolutely useless for any audio related (that is recording or playing ...
customer_reviews.text: DO NOT BUY THIS FOR ANY AUDIO APPLICATION. After testing in two different countries (USA and Brazil) in 5 different systems, it always caused interference noise on every speaker. If you plug a hard drive or a flash drive, you will hear beeps and crackles every time they loads, if you plug controllers, the noise will happen, every time there is an LED in action. This product is absolutely useless for any audio related (that is recording or playing live) application. I cannot even use it for hard drives because it introduces noise everywhere on my audio chain no matter what. Basically it will become a phone charger station so it does not go to the trash bin straight.
customer_reviews.author: Piano25

customer_reviews.title: Makes a high-pitched buzz sound
customer_reviews.text: Works well, but makes a high pitched buzzing noise when plugged into power. Also, it randomly will not connect to my laptop and requires that I unplug the aux power, plug in the hub, wait for the laptop to recognize it, and then plug the power back in. I should note that it can power my Corsair K70 mechanical RGB keyboard (with the RGB on) and my wireless mouse at my office without needing the additional power. You could likely get away without the additional power connection so long as you weren't using it to charge anything pulling significant A.
customer_reviews.author: Dr.JoeSchmoe

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed in the design and how it works.
customer_reviews.text: Strangely, my logitech usb connector would not work and I had to plug it directly into my laptop. I bought this unit to replace another Amazon Basic hub in which the connector worked find. I needed a 3.0 hub, so went with this. Those ports work well. What I don't like is the very bright blue light that indicates the unit has power. I have taped over it. Also, I miss the two direct charge hubs that my former hub provided. All considered, this is a disappointing unit and if you use logitech or are accustomed to having a couple of direct charge slots in you hub I suggest you keep looking.
customer_reviews.author: T. H. McDaniel

customer_reviews.title: Thankfully, a reliable USB 3.0 hub for once
customer_reviews.text: This is a reliable USB 3.0 hub -- a feat that can't be taken for granted at a time when the market is flooded with shoddy USB hubs from thousands of different manufacturers, that break down easily and start to "flake out" as your USB devices disconnect and reconnect every few minutes. No such problems with this device. It does what it's supposed to do without any frills, but at least it's reliable. That's worth 5 stars to me, easily.
customer_reviews.author: allquixotic

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY Fire Hazard!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Hub was fine for a while but started to spark whenever it would touch the USB port. The hub suddenly stopped working although the light was on on the unit. I restarted the computer, no dice. Turned off the computer and unplugged all USB devices, then attempted to attach the hub and SPARK! What the crap! Could have (probably did) totally damage my iMac because it was FEEDING POWER INTO IT THROUGH THE USB. Seriously faulty circuitry!
customer_reviews.author: N. Satake

customer_reviews.title: Really excellent paints
customer_reviews.text: I needed a usb hub to help charge multiple devices we have. This little hub fit all the needs I have. The cord is on the short side but other than that is perfect for my needs. I mainly use these to charge my ps4 headsets and controllers and this does a great job. The price was just right for me so I feel like I got a really good deal. I would definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: curtis blissard

customer_reviews.title: Works great right out of box!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to have more that one port with my chrome book. I wanted to plug in a wireless mouse, as you can see from the photo, the receiver fits in nicely. I teach school and need the portability of other peripherals, like a mouse; I hate using the touchpad and having the mouse makes it so much easier. But, chrome books generally have a minimal number of usb ports, so this is an inexpensive fix. Well worth the price. Shipping was quick--just a few days after ordering.
customer_reviews.author: Regina Everette

customer_reviews.title: Powered and works
customer_reviews.text: I had a different brand name hub and it would not power the various usb devces plugged in. In fact, it wouldn't even power just the mouse adapter and one other device. I tried to find a power supply for it, but the price of the power supply was more than buying a new hub. I bought this one for my wife's laptop. It comes with the power supply. It was a total plug and play device. I have no problems with any of the devices hooked to it and all work the way they should.
customer_reviews.author: GLM in VA

customer_reviews.title: Quality build at a great price
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what I needed at a price that was difficult to argue with. The only thing that wasn't clearly apparent from the description was that the two ports on the side are the ports that receive power (when the unit is connected via AC adapter). This is perfect for my situation, but I either missed the description of this, or it wasn't there. If you're needing this for three or more powered ports this may not be sufficient. Otherwise, it's a great product for the price.
customer_reviews.author: J J

customer_reviews.title: Nice little hub, cable is a bit short
customer_reviews.text: Great hub, works really well. The only complaint that I have is that the built-in USB cable is a bit short. My computer sits on a stand and I would like it more if there was enough cable to position the hub under the laptop where I want it. As is, I have let it hang off the side because I don't like the downward pressure that the cable puts on the computer's USB port if I try to position it at all. I will most likely get a usb extension cable to deal with this issue. Aside from that, I love the hub, and will probably be getting another very soon.
customer_reviews.author: zyzay

customer_reviews.title: AmazonBasics does it again...
customer_reviews.text: I have had excellent experience with AmazonBasics on anything I've bought (mostly cables). They are both excellent quality and excellent value. I've tried other hubs (powered and not), but this one certainly works better than the other half dozen I've tried. I have three HUGE disk drives funneled through this thing and no problems....that being said, trying to perform I/O on three at once might overwhelm it's capability....I don't know...but that situation is likely not to happen. So, for my purposes, it is a perfect solution.
customer_reviews.author: J. Bevan

customer_reviews.title: Not PS4 compatible.
customer_reviews.text: This is a very cheaply made hub. While it will do some things it does not work for a Playstation 4. This hub powers off every 15 minutes and then has to be woken up by a device. So that means, if you use it for headphones, harddrives, vr, charging or really anything that after 15 minutes you will lose connection. It won't even read most hard drives. Headphones lose connection after 15 minutes and has to reconnect. Controllers drop connection after 15 minutes and have to reconnect. VR stops responding after 15 minutes and has to reconnect. So, what I am saying is, if you want this for a PS4, do not buy it.
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: Gets the job done
customer_reviews.text: No complaints. I have this mounted under my desk and it works great. Note that this unit comes with a power supply, which in my experience is necessary to power anything beyond a mouse and keyboard.
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: Unstable power connection
customer_reviews.text: Using this for vr. Purchased in combination with an extension cable that I verified worked on it's own. The powered USB hub was to aid sending extra per down the large extension cable. And it worked. Well, it did for about 20 minutes. Before long, the cable started having the symptoms from the cable without power, suggesting that the power from the hub was giving out. This wouldn't be so bad if it weren't for the fact that when this happens my headphones screech so loud it deafens me for a new minutes. Can't recommend if it can't do the one thing I assume most people bought it for: the built in power.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: worked great! Then I went to plug in a third
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as i have many USB peripherals (I am an electronic musician) plugged in two devices (two usb>midi controllers), worked great! Then I went to plug in a third, a synthesizer, "not enough usb resources available" so then i plugged that device directly to my computer without any error. Maybe I'm doing something wrong, but i paid for 7 ports.......
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Discs disconnect after a while
customer_reviews.text: While the hub works, after a while (don't have the exact time) the two drives attached to it will become "invisible" - they appear to be empty with no content. If I unplug the hub, and plug it back in, everything re-appears. Makes it somewhat useless. Both drives work fine when plugged into the computer (PC) directly. Don't know exactly how the hub could cause this. .
customer_reviews.author: E-consumer

customer_reviews.title: Underpowered, useless
customer_reviews.text: Now leery of amazon branded items since several have proved to be garbage. 2.5 Amps works for exactly one device with reasonable overhead. Some phones draw 3.1 Amps for charging if you use it for that purpose. With 10 ports look for something with a minimum of 60 Watts to be useful. This thing is a dud, it does not work and good luck if you connect multiple thumb drives. lol
customer_reviews.author: Jax

customer_reviews.title: Worked - for 7 months then died! Under Warranty though
customer_reviews.text: Died after 7 months. Worked just fine and then one day none of my devices that draw small amounts of power worked. It still acts as a pass through for non-powered devices (one of my monitors is hooked up via USB) but nothing else works, ie a small usb desk light, keyboard Bluetooth fob, Phone charger. Amazon kind enough to replace since it’s under warranty so I give it two stars instead of zero.
customer_reviews.author: McB

customer_reviews.title: Great hub and priced right. Works well with my Raspberry Pi Media player.
customer_reviews.text: I needed a powered hub to connect several hard drives to my Raspberry Pi media player running Kodi, as the Pi itself doesn't supply enough power to run them. This AmazonBasics 4 port USB hub was reasonably priced and had a power supply with a decent amount of oomph for the drives. To make a long story short, I plugged in the three disks, connected the power and connected the unit to my Raspberry Pi. The disks were detected and have been running fine ever since. AmazonBasics did the job again. Supplied a common item at a great price!
customer_reviews.author: Joe S.

customer_reviews.title: Speed-wise, this seems to work, but I'm highly ...
customer_reviews.text: Speed-wise, this seems to work, but I'm highly concerned about it as every time I plug in the USB from the hub to the computer, I see sparks. I currently believe this isn't actually dangerous to the computer (the computer is both grounded and fault protected through each USB connector and could handle a faulty ground), but it's definitely concerning. The solution here could be to turn off the hub and not turn it on until after it's connected, but I don't think that's how most people will use it and honestly, I just don't expect to be seeing enough of a voltage difference in a USB connection to see sparks. That's concerning.
customer_reviews.author: Mac

customer_reviews.title: Good quality - cheap price
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to be used to multiply the USB inputs on my TV. Didn't need USB 3.0 for that Worked great. Length of the cable is just prefect - now I don't need to fumbling around the narrow space at the back side of my wall mounted TV. Secondly, I use one for an old laptop that I handed down to my daughter. Works great.
customer_reviews.author: A. Levy

customer_reviews.title: Hardy hub, great for peripherals
customer_reviews.text: I use this for our family computer downstairs (acting as a quasi-HTPC) and I just got one for my upstairs "office." Downstairs, it's been abused for more than a year. Constant plugging and unplugging, and it sits freely on the floor for people to trip on, step on, and yanked by USB wire. Yes, I know this sounds absolutely terrible, but this also attests to the hardiness of this hub. I have only had one port fail to recognize USB devices... but this works very, very well for peripherals with no issues otherwise.
customer_reviews.author: Ray B.

customer_reviews.title: It's garbage.
customer_reviews.text: Ordered in September of 2016 and it just quit working. Lost keyboard and mouse function and that tipped me off that something was wrong. Both keyboard and mouse function perfectly when connected directly to the PC. As with most powered hubs, usually one USB attachment will work, when the power is not supplied, but not with this unit. When it's fried, it's fried. Replaced with a $50 Belkin unit and I can now replace everything in its spot. What a major pain and inconvenience. Avoid this hub. It's garbage.
customer_reviews.author: David A. Albright

customer_reviews.title: Worked ok for a while, additional power never worked
customer_reviews.text: Worked well for about a year. Then I started getting warnings that there was not enough power to support my devices (a webcam, microphone, and headphones). It was plugged into the wall the entire time. Removing one of the devices seemed to fix it. Then eventually it could only support one device at a time. A few weeks ago it completely stopped working, even for something low-power like a keyboard.
customer_reviews.author: Robert F

customer_reviews.title: Price is right, cord is short
customer_reviews.text: I just needed an inexpensive way to access the USB ports on the back of my older PC (no USB 3.0 ports) so tried this option based on the price. My only complaint is that the connecting USB cable is pretty short, so you're a little limited to where you can plug it in. I can use the top-most row of USB ports on my PC and rest the hub on top of my PC case. If my PC were on a desk, I'd probably have to use the bottom-most row to have the hub sit flat on the desk. Otherwise, works as expected.
customer_reviews.author: C. Borresen

customer_reviews.title: Most ports are OFF and don't supply any power if parent device is off
customer_reviews.text: Except for fast charge (2) ports everything is turned off as long as the hub controller (PC) is off. It makes sense if you intend to plug in, say, 8 pen drives, but who does that? Thing is, if you intend to use it to charge your phone while powering up, say, Harmony, Lutron or any other similar device - well - forget it. It won't work.
customer_reviews.author: Tomasz

customer_reviews.title: I hate this thing
customer_reviews.text: This hub is flaky and I've been putting up with it since I got it. Today alone my wired USB keyboard has simply stopped working several times and left me unplugging and plugging it back in to different USB ports on the hub and hoping it would start working again. My iPhone connection (oem cable) also randomly drops, and the support/consistency for various peripherals has always been a hope-and-pray process.
customer_reviews.author: J. V. Semmelrock

customer_reviews.title: Not reliable. constantly disconnects/doesn't always connect properly.
customer_reviews.text: this mostly works some of the time, however when using two devices, especially two thumbdrives, it will constantly disconnect both, sometimes during a file transfer. i've also had an issue where i was opening the files from my camera, and file explorer would freeze without loading all the photos. i tried multiple times, disconnecting and reconnecting, and it only worked through a direct connection to the computer, suggesting the problem was this adapter.
customer_reviews.author: Am

customer_reviews.title: Not a powered hub
customer_reviews.text: This does not include a power adapter, even though the description says: In The Box - AmazonBasics 4 Port USB 2.0 Hub - AC Power Adapter - USB A to Micro USB adapter - Instruction Manual That's fine with me I didn't need power, just making that observation. That said I am happy with the purchase - great price and seems sturdy. Minus 1 star for the confusing description.
customer_reviews.author: LANMan

customer_reviews.title: Do not use with USB audio devices
customer_reviews.text: I got this to simplify my home office. It's done everything as expected, except handling USB audio devices. With either my Plantronics C520-M or AudioQuest Dragonfly v1.2 there's noticeable background noise that isn't present when run directly from the USB port on my machine (HP laptop). I would gladly pay more than the commodity USB hub price for one that could give me some assurance it won't "get in the way" of good sound.
customer_reviews.author: Nicholas Ade

customer_reviews.title: This works fine except for the purpose of which I bought it
customer_reviews.text: This works fine except for the purpose of which I bought it. It Does NOT work to expand PS4 ports. It can ONLY work from ONE power source at a time, not both. This causes a problem because the ps4 doesn't supply enough power to the USB ports to run this hub for multiple attachments: headset, wired controller, and so on. So when this is plugged into the ps4, the ac power supply is turned off. When unplugged it turns back on. I'm looking for something that operates from just the ac wall plug only, but still transfers data through the USB.
customer_reviews.author: Sean

customer_reviews.title: Good product with 7 high-speed USB ports
customer_reviews.text: Good product with 7 high-speed USB ports. Does what it's supposed to. However, it stays powered-on, even when the computer is shut off, and there is an INSANELY bright blue LED light on it that I had to put several layers of tape over to avoid having to unplug it every night to sleep. Definitely recommend removing the LED, and possibly adding a power switch. Otherwise, I'm very satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: Perry

customer_reviews.title: I thought AmazonBasics meant reliable
customer_reviews.text: I've had this hub for well over a year so I can't send it back. Therefore, I'm giving it a one-star rating. It was never very reliable so part of my annoyance is with myself. I kept making excuses for the reasons that my USB 3.0 devices attached to it were dropping out. Now I know it was just this hub. I'm giving no long explanation of the various tests I've run on this item. I'm too fed up.
customer_reviews.author: Orlando Furioso

customer_reviews.title: AmazonBasics 4-Port USB
customer_reviews.text: This was just what I needed. My laptop just did not have enough ports for me to work efficiently. Appears to be good quality and I have had NO trouble with any of the ports. Connections are snug - no slop or wiggle room. Cord is approx. 9.5" for end to end which works for me - I did not want a lot of additional cord to deal with.
customer_reviews.author: Colleen

customer_reviews.title: Not Apple Friendly Unless You’re Using Your Computer
customer_reviews.text: Well, apparently, this item only charges Apple products when it is plugged into the computer. That’s too bad, because I rarely use my computer. I needed this to charge my Apple products by plugging it into the wall. However, it does charge my non-Apple products just fine while being plugged into the wall. I was going to return it, but since I only paid $6.99 for it, I’ll keep it, and buy an additional product to charge my Apple items.
customer_reviews.author: Dee

customer_reviews.title: Works better without the Wall AC power adapter; Works with Hauppauge USB TV Tuner
customer_reviews.text: Works better without the Wall AC power adapter. I have an Western Digital USB 3 Portable Hard Drive and a Hauppauge USB TV Tuner 950Q plugged into this Hub. First, I tried without using the AC Power adapter and everything worked well. A few days later I thought maybe it is better to plug in the 120V power adapter. Big mistake! The TV Tuner quit working. I spent a lot of time troubleshooting to no avail and was almost ready to send this back to Amazon. As a last ditch resort, I removed the AC power adapter and the TV tuner started working again. If it ain't broke don't fix it!
customer_reviews.author: KnockOnWood

customer_reviews.title: It's a small issue, but it bothers me
customer_reviews.text: The power is on the side, but the powered USB ports are on the other side, which means that this need a lot of horizontal running distance to use it. I acutally turned it vertically and rest it on the edge of my desk and the wall. I think it could be better if the ports were on the top, but that might just be me. I do like that it is all usb 3.0. and powered.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Pinney

customer_reviews.title: Didn't Work (for me)
customer_reviews.text: Both of my computers failed to recognize anything I connected to this hub. They seemed to recognize the hub itself though. It's gotten great reviews, so I have to conclude that I just got a defective one. That, however, doesn't change my review. I'm very busy, so I wound up waiting too long to return it (plus I'd already tossed the box), so at least that gave me the chance to fantasize that I'm wealthy enough to have spent good money for nothing and it didn't faze me!
customer_reviews.author: Toulinwoek

product_meta.title: AmazonBasics 7 Port USB 3.0 Hub with 12V/3A Power Adapter
